title: Dance Party at Bryant Park
description: Meet at the Bryant Park fountain for the 11th annual outdoor dance party series, featuring six themed evenings of Motown, Afrofusion, Bachata and Merengue, and Brazilian Samba and Forró.

title: Meditation at Madison Square Park
description: Join in a lunchtime guided meditation class in Madison Square Park (Flatiron), where you'll practice cultivating comfort and stillness in the center of our bustling city.

title: Not in My Backyard! A Political Comedy Roundtable
description: A panel of opinionated NYC comedians, journalists, and politicians debate the local issues causing drama in your neighborhood’s Facebook group.

title: Free Outdoor Movie: Fall Guy
description: Weather permitting, enjoy a free outdoor movie screening of Fall Guy (1947) at Coleman Playground (LES).

title: Subway Series Comedy
description: Next stop, a subway-themed cannabis dispensary for Priya Blunts’s subway series comedy show, featuring various comedians.

title: We Have Fun: A Stand-Up Show
description: Hosts Zach Sims and Dan Wilbur bring the fun-ny to Young Ethel’s (South Slope), with stand-up by various comedians.

title: Punderdome: Comedy Pun Slam
description: Pun-masters have a war of the words at the beloved pun-slinging competition, hosted by Fred Firestone.

title: Ambush Comedy Show
description: The Ambush Comedy Show takes over Stefano’s Tattoo Studio in Williamsburg for a night of jabs and jokes, featuring various comedians.

title: What Happened with Why – Episode 5
description: Hannibal Buress explores the failure of his 2015 comedy central show with a screening and commentary.

title: Giving Up Screening and Panel
description: Kris Lefcoe presents a screening and panel discussion of her 2018 half-hour pilot, celebrating its long-overdue public premiere.

title: Friends with Caveats
description: Expect everything from stand-up and character performances to music and even PowerPoint presentations at Caveat's weekly comedy show.

title: Summer on the Hudson
description: Riverside Park + West Harlem Piers Park's annual arts and culture festival returns for its 23rd year with nearly 400 free events.

title: The Whitney's Decade Downtown
description: The Whitney Museum of American Art celebrates its decade in the Meatpacking District with 10 weeks of special programs and events.

title: LES History Month
description: Lower East Side History Month, founded in 2014, is an annual celebration of the stories and peoples of the LES.

title: Serials Short Play Series
description: Five teams of actors perform five original, 10-minute episodic plays, each with only six hours of rehearsal time.

title: 15th Annual Lower East Side Film Festival
description: The annual fest celebrates indie film with five days of premiere feature films, short showcases, industry talks, and parties.

title: 15th Annual Westfest Dance Festival
description: The West Fest Dance Festival presents work by 24 artists in two unique programs at Westbeth Artist Housing (West Village).

title: Dumbo First Thursday Gallery Walk
description: Explore Dumbo's waterfront arts scene at the first Thursday gallery walk, where eight galleries will stay open late for a night of opening receptions, special events, and artist talks.

title: The Rally Reading Series: ‘The Heart of a March in the Body of a Reading Series’
description: The Rally Reading Series returns for an evening of readings and discussion with various authors.

title: John and Scott: Two Person Improv
description: Former 30 Rock cast members Scott Adsit and John Lutz pair up for an improv show at UCB Theatre (East Village).

title: Free Outdoor Movie: Ghostbusters: Frozen Empire
description: Weather permitting, enjoy a free outdoor movie screening at De Witt Clinton Park (Hell’s Kitchen).

title: Tip Top Tits Comedy Show
description: It’s comedy or bust at Janet Hyde and Mary Cella’s stand-up show, featuring various comedians.

title: In Dreams – A Drag Tribute to David Lynch
description: Miss Malice and Mettie present a pair of drag tributes to the vision of David Lynch, with performances by various artists.

title: Cherry Blossom Update
description: Brooklyn Botanic Garden’s main rows of the cherry esplanade, filled with 100 trees, are in peak bloom!
cost: $22 general, $16 seniors/students, free community tickets may also be available

title: Rooftop Cinema Club
description: Take your movie night to new heights at Rooftop Cinema Club, the annual open-air movie series held at the third floor skylawn rooftop of the Embassy Suites Hotel in Midtown. Catch cult favorites, classics, and newer releases all season long, with provided wireless headphones to help block out the city buzz.
cost: $12-29 admission (15% off for military, 10% off for students)

title: Tai Chi in Bryant Park
description: Bryant Park's free outdoor tai chi classes return for the 2025 season. Held at the park's fountain terrace, the classes are open to all experience levels and take place rain or shine—unless weather is severe.

title: Clothing Swap
description: Give your closet a refresh! Swap your under-used clothes for new-to-you finds at this clothing swap, hosted by Adverse Abstraction at Otto’s Shrunken Head (East Village). Unclaimed items will be donated to Housing Works.
cost: $5 admission (2-for-1 tickets are available for a limited time)

title: A Protest History of the United States
description: Writer, professor of constitutional law, civil rights attorney, and playwright Gloria J. Browne-Marshall presents her latest book, which chronicles key dissident movements in the U.S. and the stories of the people behind them.
cost: $5 admission can be applied towards any book or item in the café.

title: David Mamet’s A Life in the Theatre
description: Tony Award winners Santino Fontana and BD Wong take the stage for a one-night-only reading of David Mamet’s wildly entertaining play at Symphony Space (UWS).

title: Econlol: An Economics-Themed Comedy Show
description: Bringing together comedians and sometimes real-life economists, Luke Strathmann's economics-themed comedy show won't teach you anything about the economy, but it will give you a chance to laugh at it.

title: Cinema Smootaphilia: Emmanuelle
description: Ensemble Erotic performs a live, original soundtrack to 1974 French softcore classic, Emmanuelle, starring Sylvia Kristel.

title: Whiskey River Revival: A Willie Nelson Birthday Celebration
description: Brooklyn band The Loyales and a large roster of guest performers pay tribute to Willie Nelson with a night of music celebrating his legendary catalog.
cost: $12 with promo code ‘whiskey5’ (reg. $18.67 adv, $24.58 day of)

title: 2025 World Voices Festival
description: Celebrating the 20th anniversary of the World Voices Festival with 100+ writers from 35 countries, including Chimamanda Ngozi Adichie, Jennifer Egan, and many more. Timely sessions including a film screening and discussion about writing in exile, writing about the end of democracy, and more.
cost: Various prices, many events are free.
